titleStmt.title: B. A. Williamson to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2162

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Elizabeth Town August 30th 1865
Honorable Thomas E Bramlet

Dear sir your excelency will confer a favor on me by accepting my resignation of the office of Justice of the peace for Hardin County, I have served the public for some three years and I find ^it^ incompatible with my Business arrangements to hold the office any longer and I hope you will through your climency give confer the dignity on some other man that is more worthy or competant than I am to fill place, I have the honor to remain your Honable servent

Hardin Co
Resignation of Justice Peace
accptd 4 Sept/65
